title: Having problem with install  Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable
body:
I just built up my new computer and get Win 10 Pro done. When I install the game, it asks to install  Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable first. However, it turns out** Command line option syntax error. Type Command /? for help.**After two times failure, it pop-up **Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable (x64) mandatory prerequisite was not correctly installed.** I went through the whole Internet and found some examples like me. I tried the solutions that they provide but they don't work at all. However, I do notice that I don't have  Visual C++ 2005 SP1 installed before, therefore I use DirectX to fix it. I think it should be OK after I got it installed. However, the same problem still exists. I tried to go to Microsoft's website and download the  Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable straightforward but same thing happen again!

I checked some discussion before and I found some cases are similar to me but not the same. Their solutions are not working for me.

I am so confused right now because there are so many different solutions in there and I can't do all of it. If some one met the same problem and fixed it, I want to know how to solve it.
Please help me, I want to play this game so hard!

replies.body: You do need to make sure you have Visual C++ installed before League will work properly. Check [**this link**](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=5638) if you haven't yet for the download. If that's the download that isn't working properly, go ahead and hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to get a little more in-depth help with this.
